context: As part of an ongoing security incident, a hands-on-keyboard attack via Impacket toolkit was observed, indicating an attempt to move laterally across the network. During this attack, a command was suspiciously executed on the device named `mb-adfs`. The attack involved multiple stages and tactics, including credentials memory read and a phishing campaign originating from a compromised internal user account.
question: Can you identify the sender's email address of the malicious email messages that were delivered and later removed as part of the phishing campaign?
solution_steps: A command via Impacket was executed by the process `lsass.exe`.
A sensitive credential memory read was performed by a user with AadUserId `a2d0f7c2-b0a0-43bd-bce0-27d8ae3be4d0` on `lsass.exe`.
An internal phishing campaign was executed by a user with AadUserId `28058d92-fc24-4869-9231-6546a34b00f2`, indicating potential compromise.
Email messages containing a malicious URL were sent by `4qs6v9m@vnevado.alpineskihouse.co` and later removed after delivery.
